channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - HP Hero
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: People who've had coronavirus are not necessarily immune from reinfection by the presence of antibodies, the World Health Organization warns
item.description: Tracking US cases | Podcast | Catch up | Q&A | Life after lockdown

item.title: Why some think herd immunity could end the pandemic
item.description: The concept of herd immunity is a simple one. But achieving it? Not so much.

item.title: How a media-distracted Trump derailed his own briefing
Watch Dr. Birx's reaction to Trump's dangerous suggestion
item.description: President Trump asked William Bryan, head of science and technology for DHS, to study UV light and dangerously injecting disinfectant to treat coronavirus. Medical experts agree that sunlight and disinfectant are not safe human treatments for coronavirus.

item.title: Worldwide coronavirus death toll passes 200,000
White House official tries to move CNN reporter at briefing
item.description: CNN's Jim Acosta discusses why President Trump ended the coronavirus briefing without taking questions and how a White House official tried to move a CNN reporter to the back of the room.

item.title: Opinion: We need to fix this key thing before reopening
item.description: With the US surpassing the grim toll of 50,000 confirmed Covid-19 deaths, perhaps our nation will now properly address the epidemic.

item.title: Best moments from CNN and Sesame Street's coronavirus town hall for kids and parents
item.description: â€¢ Watch the entire town hall

item.title: Biden's accuser says mother called into 'Larry King Live' in 1993 for advice after alleged sexual assault
item.description: Newly surfaced video from 1993 appears to feature the mother of Tara Reade, a woman who accused presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden of sexual assault, calling into a cable TV show to seek advice around the time of the alleged assault.

item.title: The race for a vaccine is moving faster than ever. Is that a good thing?
item.description: Tracking US cases | Podcast | Catch up | Q&A | Life after lockdown

item.title: How coronavirus has shaken the US military
item.description: The Department of Defense had unusual visitors on Thursday morning.

item.title: Small business owners weigh the risks as they face reopening in some states
item.description: LaVinda Miller knew her first year as a small business owner would be hard -- but not this hard.

item.title: Biden makes ominous warning about 2020 and President Trump
item.description: The Trump campaign is dismissing Joe Biden's warning that the President will try to postpone the November presidential election because of the coronavirus pandemic. CNN's Abby Phillip reports what's behind Biden's stunning accusation.

item.title: Analysis: Giuliani may have said the dumbest thing yet uttered about the coronavirus
item.description: Former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani was on Laura Ingraham's show on Fox News Thursday night when the subject turned to the coronavirus -- and attempts in New York to develop a contact tracing system to be able to monitor future outbreaks.

item.title: SE Cupp: Cancel the 2020 political conventions
item.description: As the United States continues to grapple with the coronavirus pandemic, CNN's SE Cupp calls on political party leaders to cancel the upcoming Republican and Democratic National Conventions.

item.title: US Air Force pulls bombers from Guam
item.description: For the first time in 16 years, the United States Air Force has no heavy bombers on Guam.

item.title: Bill Weir: To my son, born in the time of coronavirus and climate change
item.description: My dearest River,

item.title: 'Sons of Anarchy' actor dies at 52
item.description: Actor Dimitri Diatchenko, best known as Uri on "Chernobyl Diaries," was found dead in his home in Daytona Beach, Florida, police say.

item.title: What happened on board the last cruise ship still at sea
item.description: In January 2020, the gigantic Costa Deliziosa cruise ship slipped its moorings in the Italian city of Venice and headed out into the Adriatic Sea on an around-the-world voyage. Around 2000 passengers were on board for what they hoped would be the trip of a lifetime.

item.title: Analysis: 10 leaders who mattered most on coronavirus response this week
item.description: America's fight against the coronavirus entered a new phase this week as the debate over when and how to reopen the country began in earnest.

item.title: This restaurant owner is struggling to keep her business afloat. But that's not her only coronavirus fight
item.description: Dr. Rob Gore stands in the doorway of his Brooklyn brownstone.

item.title: Andy Cohen: I have valuable antibodies, but I couldn't donate my plasma
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper speaks to TV host Andy Cohen about his experience trying to donate blood in the wake of the pandemic and being turned away due to his sexuality.

item.title: Analysis: Trump's likeability deficit could cost him in 2020
item.description: President Donald Trump has a likeability problem.

item.title: Jill Biden on possibility of Michelle Obama as husband's running mate
item.description: CNN's Alisyn Camerota asks Jill Biden if her husband, presumptive Democratic presidential nominee and former Vice President Joe Biden, would consider former first lady Michelle Obama as his running mate in the 2020 election.

item.title: Some states begin to reopen as US closes in on 1 million coronavirus cases
item.description: A few states this weekend are running a tricky experiment: Trying to reopen certain businesses and services amid the coronavirus pandemic, even against the advice of some health experts who say it risks dangerously spiking the number of cases.

item.title: We're in a golden age of TV re-runs. Soon they'll be the only thing on
item.description: Nick Offerman never knew he was part of a TV juggernaut.

item.title: 10 kinds of apples that were thought to be extinct have been rediscovered
item.description: Ten apple varieties that were thought to be extinct have been recovered thanks to a non-profit group of apple hunters.

item.title: Tom Hanks befriends bullied 8-year-old named Corona
item.description: Tom Hanks sent a letter and a gift to an 8-year-old Australian boy named Corona DeVries, who says he has been bullied because of his name. DeVries mailed Hanks a letter when he heard he was diagnosed with Covid-19.

item.title: Opinion: The one ritual keeping me sane during Covid-19
item.description: "This is so hard," my 4-year old daughter said to me in tears.

item.title: 'Queer Eye' star: You can absolutely wait to have your hair done
item.description: "Queer Eye" star and hair stylist Jonathan Van Ness spoke to CNN's Christiane Amanpour about his concerns and advice on the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: The week in 40 photos
item.description: Take a look at 40 photos of the week from April 16 through April 23.

item.title: No need to wipe down food purchases, experts say
item.description: Has wiping down your groceries and take-out food become part of your coronavirus survival kit?

item.title: Banana contestant reveals his identity on 'Masked Singer'
item.description: Bret Michaels, Poison front man, reveals his identity after competing in a banana peel costume in the singing show,"The Masked Singer."

item.title: We nixed our wedding to protect our friends and then they surprised us with one
item.description: We were boyfriends for four years. Every anniversary was a party. The engagement was epic, complete with an Instagram-worthy surprise proposal against the Los Angeles skyline. Best of all, Kartik said yes.

item.title: After her husband died from coronavirus, she found this emotional note on his phone
item.description: "I love you guys with all my heart and you've given me the best life I could have ever asked for."

item.title: Parent records talk between kids discussing coronavirus
item.description: A CNN producer heard her daughter speaking with a friend about coronavirus and decided to film it. Child psychiatrist Dr. Wanjiku F.M. Njoroge explains how to talk to your children when tough questions on race and Covid-19 come up.

item.title: In pictures: Life after lockdown
item.description: Around the world, some governments are beginning to slowly relax their social distancing restrictions.

item.title: Shop these great deals on DNA kits
Apple's $399 iPhone SE is officially here
Learn a new language with Babbel, now on sale
Some Amex cards get 20% off Amazon until 4/30
The best sales this weekend: Sephora, Rosetta Stone & more
What flying economy class could look like after the virus
item.description: It's clear flying will be different after coronavirus, and while some airlines are discussing the removal of middle seats to maintain social distancing, one airplane interiors company has come up with concepts for adapting economy class cabins.

item.title: 30 years of Hubble telescope images
item.description: The Hubble Space Telescope was launched April 24, 1990, from the space shuttle Discovery.

item.title: Prince William's reason for not watching 'Tiger King' will make you laugh
item.description: Like the rest of us, Prince William is shut in and has time to binge-watch TV, but don't expect him to be watching "Tiger King."

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
item.description: Jellyfish swimming in clear canals in Venice, a bullied boy gets an A-list level surprise and tennis players on lockdown find a unique way to play their sport. There are the videos you don't want to miss this week.

item.title: Lysol maker: Please don't drink our cleaning products
item.description: The company that makes Lysol and Dettol is urging customers not to consume its cleaning products after President Donald Trump suggested the possibility of injecting disinfectants to protect people from coronavirus.

item.title: Abigail Disney on Disney furloughs: 'What the f---'?
item.description: Abigail Disney is flabbergasted over the Walt Disney Co.'s decision to furlough hundreds of thousands low-paid workers after paying its executives millions of dollars.

item.title: The Gap is running out of money and stopped paying rent
item.description: Gap Inc. is rapidly burning through cash as its stores remain shut during the coronavirus pandemic. The clothing company said its future is uncertain if it doesn't get the help it needs to keep its business operational.

item.title: UPS employee: 'We're getting hammered right now.'
item.description: At UPS, the most frantic time of year is typically around the winter holidays. Then things level off. But these days, as the coronavirus pandemic spurs American households and businesses to buy almost everything online, the deliveries have seemed relentless.

item.title: Stores want shoppers to wear masks. Some refuse
item.description: A handful of states and cities have mandated that shoppers wear coverings in grocery stores and other public places as they try to contain the spread of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: White House staff tries to make unhinged Trump sound reasonable
item.description: You don't need to be a doctor to know that it's dangerous to ingest or inject disinfectants. A random kid on the street could tell you that.

item.title: Where Trump is trouncing Biden
item.description: By historical standards, it's still fairly early in the presidential campaign calendar. And the nation is consumed with worries about the deadly coronavirus. Nonetheless, this being an election year, both the Joe Biden and Donald Trump campaigns are already lobbing attack ads at one another.

item.title: The creative thinker Biden should pick
item.description: Nearly 30 years ago, I met Stacey Abrams at a training for student organizers hosted by the A. Philip Randolph Institute, an organization for African American trade unionists. I had just been suspended by Columbia University for protesting the university's plans to turn the Audubon Ballroom, where Malcolm X was shot to death, into a biomedical research facility. And Abrams was on her way to becoming student body president of Spelman College.

item.title: Who's accountable for Trump's nonsense?
item.description: Just when we thought President Donald Trump might be inclined to tamp down his impulses to suggest unproven and dangerous cures for Covid-19, Thursday's nightly performance brought an even wilder parade of ideas from the President. Perhaps we should consider injecting disinfectants, Trump posited, prompting the maker of Lysol to issue an urgent warning, "under no circumstance should our disinfectant products be administered into the human body (through injection, ingestion or any other route)."

item.title: W. Kamau Bell: What rancher taught me
item.description: I first met Scott Blubaugh, the president of the Oklahoma Farmers Union, last year when I was filming an episode on family farms for this summer's season of "United Shades of America." There's a lot of talk in this country of farmers as the backbone of America, and we were trying to separate the facts from the pickup truck commercial.

item.title: It's too soon for Georgia to open up
item.description: In these uncertain times, I am reminded of the life lessons I learned from my father. I saw him struggle, enduring layoffs as a welder with a middle school education, before he built a business as a janitor. He never allowed his three sons to worry or miss a meal, and he inspired me to show courage in the face of the unknown. That same heart is needed now more than ever in higher education.

item.title: Refinancing could save homeowners big $$$
Check out 2020's greatest card offers
5 free dividend stocks for 2020
World's most-populous Muslim nation bans travel over Ramadan
New Zealand leader Jacinda Ardern marks Anzac Day -- from her driveway
item.description: It's Anzac Day in New Zealand and Australia -- but people have to mark the day of remembrance a little differently this year, even prime ministers.

item.title: To get around stay-home orders, Spaniards have been walking some unusual 'pets'
Doctor: We're on standby for potential next wave
item.description: Doctors and nurses fighting Covid-19 in Britain say they fear the devastating effect that lifting lockdown restrictions could have as they standby for a second wave. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports.

item.title: Wuhan weathered Covid-19. Can it survive what's next?
The 5-month-old daughter of a New York firefighter dies from coronavirus
item.description: A New York firefighter's infant daughter has died from coronavirus, her family says, making her one of the youngest known victims of the virus.

item.title: Severe thunderstorms possible across the Southeast today
item.description: Severe storms will track across parts of the Southeast Saturday after causing damage in northeast Texas on Friday.

item.title: Colorado Walmart store shuts down after coronavirus deaths
item.description: Public health officials in Aurora, Colorado, ordered a Walmart supercenter to shut down Thursday after a 72-year-old Walmart worker, her 63-year-old husband, and a 69-year-old third-party security contractor for the company died from coronavirus.

item.title: Georgia attorney general will investigate racist text sent to Atlanta mayor and her 12-year-old son
item.description: The Georgia attorney general is investigating a racist text that was sent to Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms Wednesday night, a spokesman for the mayor confirmed.
